page.title: 10Clubs
page.content: Disbanded during the war years, Keig Scottish Women's Rural Institute re-formed in 1946. To-day there are about 30 members. Meetings are held on the third Thursday of each monthh with the exception of July. Meetings consist of a guest speaker talking about matters of domestic and general interest. There are also two competitions, one being baking, sewing or knitting while the other is usually of an artistic nature such as floral arrangements, greetings cards etc. or making use of oddments of materials. An annual outing to a place of interest is held and fund raising is carried out throughout the year for the children's Christmas Party and local and national charities.
